attributes.title: Can We Make Life? Preview
attributes.description_short: A revolution in gene editing enables scientists to create and edit DNA like never before.
attributes.description_long: "It's alive!" Since Dr. Frankenstein spoke those famous words, we've been alternately enthralled and terrified by the idea of creating life in the lab. Now, a revolution in genetic engineering and thrilling innovations in synthetic biology are bringing that dream—or nightmare, as the case may be—closer to reality. New tools allow researchers to use cells to create their own DNA.
attributes.funder_message:
National corporate funding for NOVA Wonders is provided by Draper. Major funding for NOVA Wonders is provided by National Science Foundation, the Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation, the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation and public television viewers, with additional funding for “Are We Alone?” and “What’s the Universe Made Of?” provided by the John Templeton Foundation.
This material is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation under Grant No. DRL-1420749. Any opinions, findings, and conclusions or recommendations expressed in this material are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the National Science Foundation.

attributes.title: NOVA Wonder's "Can We Make Life?" Homepage
Gene Editing Human Embryos
attributes.description_short: Chinese scientists altered the genome of a “nonviable" human embryo.

attributes.title: No More Mosquitos
attributes.description_short: A new technology, could make mosquito-borne illnesses a thing of the past.

attributes.title: Catching Genetic Diseases Early
attributes.description_short: Genetic sequencing can help doctors make life-saving diagnoses.

attributes.title: What is CRISPR gene editing?
attributes.description_short: Scientists have a new tool to edit genes in human cells to repair mutations. What is it?

attributes.title: NOVA Wonders Can We Make Life?
How does CRISPR work?
attributes.description_short: CRISPR makes gene editing faster, cheaper, and easier than ever before. Here's how.
attributes.description_long: CRISPR makes gene editing faster, cheaper, and easier than ever before. Here's how.

Bringing Back Woolly Mammoths
attributes.description_short: Mixing mammoth and elephant genes could be the key to saving the Arctic.
